name: Återbruket Kiruna

executive_summary.headline: 98% material recovery in world's most ambitious urban circular economy - entire city relocated with systematic material reuse
key_achievements: 98% material reuse/recycling rate per demolition project
45% CO2 reduction for building relocation vs demolish+rebuild (Lund LCA 2023)
31+ historic buildings designated for complete relocation
16,000 tonnes/year material flows managed by LKAB
Successful building relocations proved economically viable (Sheriff's House 2017)
Kiruna Portal concept: physical recycling yard + digital material marketplace
Railway Station bricks (lime mortar) achieving 80-95% reuse rate
Town Hall architectural elements integrated into new bathhouse and hotel
World's first city-scale material passport and reuse strategy
executive_summary.why_flagship: Kiruna represents the world's most ambitious urban-scale circular economy initiative. No other project has attempted systematic material recovery at this scale - relocating an entire city due to mining subsidence while achieving 98% material recovery. The project established methodologies for city-wide material reuse that can inform urban transformation globally.
executive_summary.why_tier: Completeness score 78/100 (Grade B). Comprehensive documentation from ARQ research project, White Arkitekter masterplan, and independent LCA study from Lund University.

narrative.driver: LKAB iron ore mining caused ground subsidence requiring relocation of entire city center. Rather than demolish and rebuild, masterplan 'Kiruna 4-Ever' conceptualized material reuse and building relocation as core strategy.
narrative.approach: Systematic material recovery: concrete crushed for road base, metals recycled, bricks salvaged (lime mortar), fixtures harvested. Complete building relocations proved economically viable after Sheriff's House success (2017). Kiruna Portal concept for digital material marketplace.
narrative.significance: World's most ambitious urban-scale circular economy. Demonstrates 98% material recovery is achievable at city scale. Provides methodology for mining communities and urban transformation globally.
narrative.legacy: Kiruna methodology being studied by urban planners worldwide. Building relocation validated as viable alternative to demolition. Material passport and marketplace concepts informing national policy.
